edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.games.treasure_hunter

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.games.treasure_hunter.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that contains all of the Player object's information such as its location and its current sprite.
    Version:
    for UCSB CS56, F17, 11/07/2017
    Author:
    Alex Wood, Danielle Dodd and George Lieu, Yusuf Alnawakhtha and Sang Min Oh

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructs a Player object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getCurrentImage()
      Returns a BufferedImage that stores an image of the Player object's current sprite.
      int getCurrentSprite()
      Returns the number of the Player object's current sprite.
      int getXPos()
      Returns the x-coordinate of the Player.
      int getXTile()
      Returns the x-tile number of the Player.

      Returns the y-coordinate of the Player.

      Returns the y-tile number of the Player.

      Returns whether the Player is currently able to move.

      Moves the Player to the specified coordinate location.

      Sets the Player object's current ability to move.
      void setSprite(int sprite)
      Sets the sprite of the Player object.
      void setTiles(int xTile, int yTile)
      Sets the tiles that the Player should be on.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int xTile,
              int yTile,
              int numSprites,
              int currentSprite,
              java.lang.String name)
        Constructs a Player object.
        Parameters:
        xTile - The current tile that the Player is on along the x-direction
        yTile - The current tile that the Player is on along the y-direction
        numSprites - The number of different sprites that exist for the Player
        currentSprite - The number of the Player object's current sprite
        name - The name of the Player
